forecast.name: Overnight
forecast.detailedForecast: Partly cloudy, with a low around 56. Southwest wind around 10 mph.

forecast.name: Wednesday
forecast.detailedForecast: Sunny. High near 72, with temperatures falling to around 70 in the afternoon. Southwest wind 7 to 21 mph, with gusts as high as 25 mph.

weather_report:
As the early hours of dawn embrace Downtown San Francisco, the sky remains partially veiled, a cocoon of soft clouds, with the temperature holding steady around a mild 56 degrees. A gentle southwest wind stirs, whispering through the streets, perhaps hinting at the brighter day that lies ahead. As morning unfurls, the city is set to bask in warm sunshine, reaching up to a comfortable 72 degrees, though a slight coolness may linger into the afternoon as temperatures taper off to around 70. 

The air, though currently cloaked in a modest layer of clouds, is not yet burdened by the thick fog that often kisses the Bay. As the day progresses, the prospect of clear skies appears promising against the backdrop of our illustrious skyline, conjuring images of leisurely strolls down Market Street or perhaps a quiet sit near the waterfront, where the cooling breeze provides respite. Dress lightly but keep a light sweater or a cardigan at hand; the day may bring warmth, but the evening could curl in with a familiar, refreshing chill reminiscent of our famed maritime climate. A simple afternoon at a cozy café, indulging in a good read or a captivating conversation, seems to be an optimal way to relish this transitional day between warmth and the cool embrace of the oncoming evening.
